intro: Hieraciodes stricta, commonly known as narrowleaf hieracium, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
